articles.title: DPRK Succeeds in Nuclear Fusion
articles.content:
DPRK Succeeds in Nuclear Fusion 
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Scientists of the DPRK succeeded in nuclear fusion reaction on the significant occasion of the Day of the Sun this year, according to Rodong Sinmun Wednesday.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The successful nuclear fusion marks a great event that demonstrated the rapidly developing cutting-edge science and technology of the DPRK.
					
					 The nuclear fusion technology is called "artificial solar" technology as it represents a field of the latest science and technology for the development of new energy desired by humankind.
					
					 The nuclear fusion technology for obtaining safe and environment-friendly new energy the source of which is abundant draws great attention of world science at present. 
					
					 Scientists of the DPRK have worked hard to develop nuclear fusion technology their own way.
					
					 They solved a great many scientific and technological problems entirely by their own efforts without the slightest hesitation and vacillation even under the conditions where everything was in short supply and there were a lot of difficulties, thus succeeding in nuclear fusion reaction at last.
					
					 In this course, Korean style thermo-nuclear reaction devices were designed and manufactured, basic researches into nuclear fusion reaction completed and strong scientific and technological forces built to perfect the thermo-nuclear technology by their own efforts.
					
					 The successful nuclear fusion in the DPRK made a definite breakthrough toward the development of new energy and opened up a new phase in the nation's development of the latest science and technology.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Greets Sri Lankan PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Greets Sri Lankan PM 
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Kim Yong Il Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Disanauaka Mudiyanselage Jayaratne on his appointment as Prime Minister of Sri Lanka.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger, the message wished him success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets New Indian Ambassador
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets New Indian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with Pratap Singh, new Indian ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him on Wednesday.

articles.title: New Chairman of UAWK Elected
articles.content:
New Chairman of UAWK Elected
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The 60th plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea took place here on May 6.
					 Present there were members of the committee and officials of the union.
					
					 The meeting relieved Chairman Kang Chang Uk of his post and recalled him and elected Ri Myong Gil to replace him.

articles.title: National Book Explaining Competition Held
articles.content:
National Book Explaining Competition Held
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The 14th national book explaining competition among publication distributing workers took place here from May 10 to 12.
					 The competition brought together at least 150 officials and workers in the field of publication distribution selected from various provinces. It was divided into group and individual contests.
					
					 The participants vividly explained the contents of the books dealing with the personality of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu as great persons, their wise leadership and immortal revolutionary histories, including long story "Era of Prosperity" from the cycle of novels "Immortal History", books "Our Leader" (Part 2), "General Kim Jong Il, the Sun of Songun" (Part 2), "Hoeryong" and other books, deeply impressing the audience. 
					
					 The audience appreciated the book explanation by way of art agitation, a combination of narration, singing and poem recital which are helpful to arousing the masses to heroic struggles and feats in work sites alive with a general offensive for improving the people's standard of living, and the high skill displayed by book distributing workers.

articles.title: New Premier League Round Begins
articles.content:
New Premier League Round Begins
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The third round of the premier league soccer matches has begun in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea as part of the Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize.
					 Participating in the matches are eight male and six female teams.
					
					 In the first male match held on Monday the Sobaeksu team won a 1:0 victory over the Rimyongsu team, which finished the first in the previous two rounds.
					
					 The matches will continue at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang till May 31.

articles.title: Popular Policies Enforced
articles.content:
Popular Policies Enforced
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A nationwide telemedicine service has begun in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea some time ago as part of the universal free medical care system.
					 The DPRK has long enforced popular policies for the sake of public well-being.
					
					 Typical of them are the compulsory free education system, universal free medical care system, system of nursing and upbringing of children and the complete abolition of taxation.
					
					 Free education ranging from primary school to university is available in the country.
					
					 The Korean people enjoy medical care, including consultation, check-up, treatment, operation, hospitalization and medication free of charge.
					
					 Even the round trip fare is paid by the state for those going to and back from sanatoria.
					
					 The state also supplies the blue and white-collar workers and their families with food, school uniforms, footwear and other school things at a price next to nil and dwelling houses free of charge.
					
					 There are many other popular policies, including paid vacations, rest at sanatoria and holiday homes, social security system and management of nurseries and kindergartens at the state expense.
					
					Such policies have been continued without interruption in the country under the care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kaesong Boasts of Many Natural Monuments
articles.content:
Kaesong Boasts of Many Natural Monuments
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Preserved in Kaesong, which was the capital of Koryo (918-1392), the first unified state of Korea, are many natural monuments.
					 Two pine trees (Sciadonitys verticillata) growing at the foot of Mt. Songak in the city are 140-odd-years old and 7.2 meters high.
					
					 The tree, which has long been considered to be one of ten animals and plants symbolizing longevity, is of ornamental and scientific value.
					
					 Growing on the campus of Songgyungwan Academy are three old trees -- a zelkova tree, 25 meters high, 7.1 meters round in lower part and 17 meters in diameter of its crown, and two ginkgo trees, over 30 meters high.
					
					 Besides, Styphnolobium japonicum, about 200 years old, Pinus bungeana, zelkova tree (Zelkova serrata) growing in Manwoldae, ginkgo tree in Kaephung,  trifoliate orange (Poncirus trifoliata) in Phanmun, terrapin living in the River Rimjin and others have been preserved in Kaesong as natural monuments.

articles.title: S. Korean DPRK-Targeted Saber Rattling under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean DPRK-Targeted Saber-rattling under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean warmongers launched "a field mobile drill" on May 10 in the areas of Inchon and Puphyong by mobilizing a regiment of the puppet army and this will reportedly last till May 14.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 A puppet army regiment's "field mobile drill" may be regarded as a commonplace event in south Korea where war maneuvers targeted on the DPRK are daily occurrences but it is something unprecedented that the south Korean warmongers opened the puppet army unit engrossed in the above-said drill to media as a "regiment to march north."
					
					 No ruling quarters of south Korea have ever opened the puppet army unit going by the above-mentioned provocative name to media. This indicates that the south Korean conservative ruling forces are more vicious-famed warmongers hell-bent on the moves to start a war of aggression on the DPRK than any other preceding ruling quarters.
					
					 It is an ulterior intention of the conservative group to imbue the people with a doctrine of a war of aggression that a fratricidal war is unavoidable and they should "march north." 
					
					 The above-said drill once again made it clear that all Koreans can neither escape scourge of a new war, a nuclear war, nor achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity so long as the conservative group is allowed to stay in power.
					
					 "March north" cried out for by the conservative group is nothing but a daydream as it is only fated to face a severe punishment by the army and people of the DPRK. The conservative group would be well advised to halt its moves to escalate the confrontation with compatriots as they are little short of digging their own graves.

articles.title: S. Korean Army to Stage Large-Scale Mobile Drills
articles.content:
S. Korean Army to Stage Large-Scale Mobile Drills
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Ssangyong unit of the puppet army announced that it would stage large-scale mobile drills in the area of Hwachon, south Korean Kangwon Province on May 13, 14 and 19, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 The puppet warmongers are contemplating mobilizing huge troops, tanks and armored cars and other arms and equipment for these drills.
					
					 They are getting frantic with maneuvers for a war of aggression against the DPRK while more feverishly inciting confrontation with compatriots than ever before to aggravate the situation on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Anti-reunification Moves Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-reunification Moves Slammed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The Civic and Public Joint Measure Committee against the Suppression of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) in south Korea called a press conference in Seoul on May 7, denouncing the group of traitors for its persistent moves to suppress the South Headquarters of Pomminryon.
					 Speakers at the conference referred to the fact that the police recently issued summons to Chairman Ri Kyu Jae, Secretary General Ri Kyong Won and Chairperson in charge of information service Choe Un A of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon on charges of violation of the "National Security Law" for the mere reason that they participated in the 11th meeting of the Joint Presidium of Pomminryon.
					
					 They charged that as part of the campaign to crack down upon this organization the security authorities conducted an investigation into the vice-chairman of the Democratic Labor Party, who was a leading member of the Kyonggi-Inchon Alliance of Pomminryon, and issued similar summons to the chairman of the Seoul District Alliance of Pomminryon and its several other leading members. 
					
					 The above-mentioned meeting was a regular meeting which decided on the orientation of the one-year reunification movement and tasks, they noted. Branding the participation in such meeting as an "activity benefiting enemy" is nothing but an act of dampening the desire of the fellow countrymen for reunification, they said, urging the authorities to stop at once their persistent suppression of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon.

articles.title: Memorandum of DPRK FM Supported in Guinea
articles.content:
Memorandum of DPRK FM Supported in Guinea
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, issued a statement on May 5 in support of the memorandum of the DPRK Foreign Ministry.
					 Noting that it is the strong desire of humankind to build a nuclear-free world, the statement said:
					
					 The denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula is part of global denuclearization.
					
					 The U.S., which had attempted to use nuclear weapons against Korea during the last Korean war, has since channeled every possible effort into making south Korea a base for nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. nuclear threat to the DPRK was brought to light in the "nuclear posture review" released in 2002.
					
					 In the review the U.S. designated the DPRK as target of nuclear attack and officially clarified that it would use nuclear weapons against the DPRK any time to meet its strategic interests.
					
					 The DPRK's accession to nuclear deterrent was prompted by its intention to defend its sovereignty.
					
					 Therefore, it serves as a powerful and just shield for peace and security of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 As proven by all the facts, the U.S. is wholly to blame for the nuclear crisis looming large to the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We will always express support and solidarity for all the measures taken by the DPRK for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world and the just cause of the DPRK.

articles.title: Corea realiza con exito la reaccion de fusion nuclear
articles.content:
Corea realiza con exito la reaccion de fusion nuclear
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- Segun el numero del dia 12 del diario Rodong Sinmun, en estos tiempos significativos en que se acogio el Dia del Sol (15 de abril, dia de natalicio del Presidente        Kim Il Sung), los cientificos coreanos lograron realizar con exito la reaccion de fusion nuclear.
					  Este exito orgulloso deviene un gran acontecimiento que hace galas de ciencias y tecnicas de punta de Corea que se desarrollan vertiginosamente.
					
					  La tecnologia de fusion nuclear se conoce como la del "sol artificial" siendo una de las ramas cientifico-tecnicas de punta para el desarrollo de la nueva energia ideal de la humanidad.
					
					  Ella llama hoy en dia gran atencion del circulo cientifico mundial porque permite obtener nueva energia segura con inagotables fuentes y sin casi ninguna contaminacion medioambiental.
					
					  Los cientificos coreanos han venido esforzandose por desarrollar al estilo coreano la tecnica de fusion nuclear.
					
					  Ellos triunfaron por fin en la reaccion de fusion nuclear tras resolver con las fuerzas del todo propias numerosos problemas cientifico-tecnicos surgidos sin vacilar ni en lo minimo ante la escasez y las dificultades.
					
					  En este proceso se ha disenado y fabricado el aparato de reaccion termonuclear al estilo coreano, termino la investigacion basica sobre la reaccion de fusion nuclear y se prepararon poderosas fuerzas cientificas y tecnicas capaces de completar con las fuerzas propias la tecnologia termonuclear.
					
					  Gracias a este exito, se abrio la brecha del desarrollo de nueva energia y quedo explorado un nuevo plano en el desarrollo de las ciencias y tecnicas nacionales de punta.

articles.title: Elegido nuevo presidente del CC de la UT
articles.content:
Elegido nuevo presidente del CC de la UTAC
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 6 en esta capital la 60a reunion plenaria del Comite Central de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea (UTAC).
					  En la ocasion participaron los miembros del CC de la UTAC y los funcionarios de este gremio.
					
					  Ri Myong Gil fue elegido como nuevo presidente del CC de la UTAC en sustitucion de su antecesor destituido Kang Chang Uk.

articles.title: Minju Joson comenta ejercicio militar del "regimiento Pukjin"
articles.content:
Minju Joson comenta ejercicio militar del "regimiento Pukjin"
						
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- Los belicistas surcoreanos estan librando a partir del dia 10 en las zonas de Inchon y Puphyong un "ejercicio de traslado al aire libre", que se extendera hasta el dia 14, movilizando un regimiento de sus tropas terrestres.
					Este ejercicio no es ninguna novedad si se toma en cuenta que en el suelo surcoreano se desarrollan casi todos los dias las maniobras de guerra contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. Pero lo insolito del caso es que los belicistas surcoreanos publicaron en la prensa que el regimiento del ejercito titere surcoreano movilizado en esa maniobra es el "Pukjin" (esta palabra significa la agresion al Norte, o sea, a la RPDC).
					
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido el dia 12 y continua:
					
					Ninguno de los anteriores gobernantes surcoreanos habia presentado a traves de la prensa las unidades militares nombradas con palabras tan agresivas como "Pukjin".
					
					Este hecho demuestra que las fuerzas conservadoras surcoreanas actualmente en el poder son los belicistas mas connotados que maniobran mas abiertamente que sus antecesoras para desatar la guerra contra la RPDC.
					
					La camarilla de conservadores surcoreanos intenta infundir a los habitantes la conciencia de guerra agresiva de que es inevitable la guerra fratricida y se debe "agredir al Norte".
					
					El polemico ejercicio del "regimiento Pukjin" vuelve a comprobar que dejando intacta a esa banda, la nacion coreana no podra eludir los desastres de la nueva guerra nuclear ni lograr la reunificacion independiente ni la paz ni la prosperidad. 
					
					Lo que espera a ella, que suena ridiculamente con "agredir al Norte", es el castigo implacable del ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC.
					
					Los conservadores surcoreanos deben desistir de sus maniobras de confrontacion fratricida que les llevaran a la autodestruccion.

articles.title: Iniciado torneo de todos contra todos de futbol
articles.content:
Iniciado torneo de todos contra todos de futbol
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- En la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fue iniciado el torneo de todos contra todos de futbol de nivel supremo de la Competencia Deportiva por la Copa Antorcha de Pochonbo.
					En el torneo tomaron parte 8 equipos masculinos y  6 femeninos.
					
					En el primer partido que tuvo lugar el dia 10 el equipo masculino de futbol del Conjunto Deportivo Sobaeksu vencio 1 por 0 al otro del Conjunto Deportivo Rimyongsu que habia ocupado el primer lugar en los dos partidos anteriores de todos contra todos.
					
					El torneo sigue hasta el 31 de mayo en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung.
